tweet:
“It’s interesting and different every day”

Watch @AppropsDems Staff Director Shalanda Young explain to @TheHill her role in keeping our government open, funding critical priorities, & why @AppropsDems are committed to avoiding another government shutdown. https://thehill.com/homenews/house/472386-house-appropriations-staff-director-no-one-feels-great-when-the-government …

ICYMI —  this summer, @AppropsDems raised questions with the Trump Administration after two @AppropsDems staffers traveled to Ukraine & found that U.S. assistance was being held up.

Read more ⤵️ https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/house-staffers-summer-trip-ukraine-learned-u-s-aid-was-n1084741 …

Recent legislation to keep the government open is likely to bring calls for 'automatic continuing resolutions' to avoid costly shutdowns.

@NitaLowey explains why putting spending on autopilot would shift power to the President & undermine Congress.⤵️ https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/politics/471658-dont-put-discretionary-spending-on-autopilot …

After this week's continuing resolution, we're sure to see renewed calls for "automatic CRs."

While well-intentioned, putting spending on autopilot would weaken Congress' power of the purse at a time of blatant executive overreach.

@NitaLowey explains ⤵️
 https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/politics/471658-dont-put-discretionary-spending-on-autopilot …

This summer, @AppropsDems staffers traveled to Ukraine to see firsthand impacts of Congressionally-approved military aid & foreign assistance.

They found funds were being held up, & demanded explanations from the Trump Administration.

Read their story ⤵️
 https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/house-staffers-summer-trip-ukraine-learned-u-s-aid-was-n1084741 …

The House's CR now signed into law provides budget certainty, a military pay raise, & a fully-funded #2020Census.

With gov. funding extended, @AppropsDems remain committed to working in good faith to enact responsible, full-year spending bills that invest in critical priorities. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1197647607948042241 …

🚨 JUST IN: The House just passed, by a bipartisan vote of 231 to 192, a continuing resolution to keep government open, extend health programs, fully fund the #2020Census, & raise military pay.

Read @NitaLowey's full statement & learn more ⤵️
 https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/house-passes-continuing-resolution-0 … pic.twitter.com/LTkpBWuFYe
The House is voting NOW to pass this continuing resolution ⤵️ https://twitter.com/AppropsDems/status/1196866864443482114 …

Energy & Water Development @AppropsDems Chairwoman @RepMarcyKaptur:

"this continuing resolution ensures that 

💡 the government and its lights stay on

💵 that we pay our bills on time

🏦 and that the peoples' business continues while negotiations on a full year deal proceed"

Chairwoman @NitaLowey from the House floor:

"While the House did its work...delays in the Senate mean the appropriations process is behind.

This CR will allow additional time to negotiate and enact responsible long-term funding" https://appropriations.house.gov/news/press-releases/lowey-floor-remarks-on-continuing-resolution-through-december-20 …

We are already feeling the impacts of climate change through more extreme storms, floods, fires, and droughts.

On Wednesday at 10am, Energy Chairwoman @RepMarcyKaptur & @AppropsDems will examine the Department of @ENERGY’s role in addressing this crisis.
 https://appropriations.house.gov/events/hearings/the-department-of-energy-s-role-in-addressing-climate-change … pic.twitter.com/7NRf53Ndwb

Why can the President not withhold funds approved by Congress?

Because that is what’s called “impoundment”, and there are laws against it.

Learn more with this handy explainer from @HouseBudgetDems 👇👇👇  https://twitter.com/HouseBudgetDems/status/1195750583631777797 … pic.twitter.com/rT0oszv8bD
